Hi Parthiv,

To create a region dynamically and place it at a particular location there are two main things to get done:

  1. Add the control that will host the region (ItemsControl, ContentControl, etc) to the VisualTree. This is when you will selected the location of the element and its layout. Prism does not provide any particular support for this, so you might find a better answer on how to get this done in the WPF forums.
  2. Create a Region to be hosted in the control. To make that control a region you can use code the RegionManager’s SetRegionName method: 
    RegionManager.SetRegionName(yourControl, "YourNewRegion");

Please let me know if this helps.
